attributes.action: Tell Cia Qi, Mayor of Beijing, to take down Huya.com's animal torture channels
attributes.additional_details: The Beijing News reported that these videos gain over 100,000 views (who are these people)?! and their videos include footage of protected animals being tortured and killed. The Beijing News also stated that animals were hunted, captured and abused, sometimes forced to fight each other to the death. Huya.com should not allow these videos to be broadcasted.
attributes.background: Huya.com, China's massive live video streaming site, has no restrictions whatsoever on animal torture channels, meaning that (somehow) they gain up to 460,000 subscribers. Cia Qi, Beijing's mayor (and the rest of the government) needs to create stricter regimes when it comes to broadcasting cruelty

rejection.details:
We cannot accept your petition because the UK Government or Parliament are not responsible for the issue you raise. This petition seems to be calling on the Chinese Government, not the UK Government or Parliament, to take action.

You could start a new petition calling on UK Government to raise this issue with the government of China.
